algorithm_technique: Linear scan with boundary checks for 'good' elements.
problem_summary_simple: Sum elements that are strictly greater than elements k positions away.
problem_summary_technical: Iterates through the array, checking if each element is strictly greater than its neighbors at indices i-k and i+k, if they exist.
key_insights: The definition of a 'good' number involves checking elements at specific offsets (i-k and i+k).
Careful handling of boundary conditions (i-k < 0 or i+k >= len(nums)) is crucial.
A single pass through the array is sufficient to identify and sum all good numbers.
